remarks: Deduce a group from its properties.  In this version of ~ isgrpd , we don't assume there is an expression for the inverse of ` x ` . (Contributed by NM, 6-Jan-2015.)
statement:
isgrpd.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd.p $e |- ( ph -> .+ = ( +g ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B /\ y e. B ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. B ) $.
isgrpd.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B /\ z e. B ) ) -> ( ( x .+ y ) .+ z ) = ( x .+ ( y .+ z ) ) ) $.
isgrpd.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. e. B ) $.
isgrpd.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( .0. .+ x ) = x ) $.
isgrpde.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> E. y e. B ( y .+ x ) = .0. ) $.
isgrpde $p |- ( ph -> G e. Grp ) $.
$d .+ x y z $.
$d .0. x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d G x y z $.
$d ph x y z $.
